description:
Endotricha flammealis is a species of moth belonging to the family Pyralidae. It is commonly known as the flame brocade or flamed brocade moth.

The moth has a wingspan of around 20-25 millimeters. The forewings are reddish-brown in color with darker patches and a distinctive zigzag pattern, giving it a flame-like appearance. The hindwings are greyish-brown.

Endotricha flammealis is distributed across Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. The larvae of this species feed on a variety of plants, including clover, lucerne, and other legumes.

The moth is nocturnal and is attracted to artificial light sources. It can be found in various habitats, including grasslands, pastures, and agricultural areas.

Overall, Endotricha flammealis is a small yet visually striking moth species that is widely distributed across its range.
